meta.hint: Most verbs are regular in the past tense. That means you follow a rule like "add -ed" or  "add -d" to get the past-tense form of the verb. Some verbs are irregular in the past tense. That means you don't follow a rule.  Instead, you must remember the past-tense form of the verb. Example - Luis did his homework. (Did is the irregular past-tense form of do.)
meta.question: Select the sentence with correct  irregular past tense.

content.description: Which sentence is in the past tense?
content.extra: The children fly kites, The children flew kites.

content.word: Shelly found a pair of gloves under the chair.
content.description: Which sentence is in the past tense?
content.extra: Shelly found a pair of gloves under the chair, Shelly finds a pair of gloves under the chair.
